entity1.name: Animals
entity1.description: A diverse group of invertebrate animals that includes snails, clams, and octopuses, which can be prey for mantis shrimp.;;;A broad group of multicellular, eukaryotic organisms that are capable of locomotion and respond to their environment.
entity1.chunkid: Unusual Animal Adaptations1;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations12;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations3

entity3.name: axolotl
entity3.description: A type of salamander known for its ability to regenerate lost body parts, including limbs, tail, and even parts of its brain and spinal cord.;;;A type of salamander known for its ability to regenerate body parts.;;;A type of salamander known for its unusual adaptations.;;;A type of salamander known for its ability to regenerate limbs, spinal cord, heart, and other organs.
entity3.chunkid: Unusual Animal Adaptations8;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations7;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations6;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations5

entity4.name: Mexico
entity4.description: A country in North America where the axolotl is native to.

entity7.name: Scientists
entity7.description: A collective term for people engaged in scientific research and experimentation.;;;Professionals who conduct scientific research and experiments to understand natural phenomena.

entity9.name: humans
entity9.description: The common name for the species Homo sapiens, characterized by their capacity for complex language, abstract reasoning, and problem-solving skills.

entity10.name: mantis shrimp
entity10.description: A colorful crustacean known for its unique adaptations, found in tropical waters.;;;A marine crustacean known for its powerful striking appendages used to attack prey.;;;A marine crustacean known for its unique hunting strategy and powerful strike, making it a formidable predator in underwater environments.;;;A marine crustacean known for its powerful striking ability.
entity10.chunkid: Unusual Animal Adaptations9;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations13;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations12;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations10

entity11.name: tropical waters
entity11.description: Warm water environments typically located near the equator where various marine species thrive.

entity13.name: .22 caliber bullet
entity13.description: A small ammunition commonly used in firearms, known for its speed and penetration power.

entity14.name: club-like appendage
entity14.description: A specialized body part that can accelerate at high speeds, often found in certain animals such as the mantis shrimp.

entity16.name: crabs
entity16.description: Aquatic or terrestrial crustaceans with a broad, flat body and a short tail, often the prey of mantis shrimp.

entity19.name: pangolin
entity19.description: A mammal known for its unique scales and ability to curl into a protective ball when threatened.;;;A mammal known for its distinctive scales which serve as a form of armor against predators.;;;A mammal known for its unique protective scales.;;;A mammal known for its unique scales and ability to roll into a ball as a defense mechanism.;;;A mammal known for its distinctive scales and being one of the most trafficked animals in the world.
entity19.chunkid: Unusual Animal Adaptations14;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations18;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations15;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations17;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations16

entity20.name: keratin
entity20.description: A fibrous structural protein that is the main component of hair, nails, and the outer layer of skin in mammals.

entity21.name: human hair and nails
entity21.description: Keratin-based structures found on humans, serving protective and functional roles.

entity26.name: scales
entity26.description: The hard, protective outer covering of a pangolin, often sought after for their supposed medicinal properties.

entity27.name: common swift
entity27.description: A bird known for its aerial lifestyle and specialized adaptations for efficient flight.;;;A bird known for its extraordinary flying abilities.;;;A bird species known for spending most of its life in the air, only landing to breed.;;;A small bird species known for its long migratory flights.
entity27.chunkid: Unusual Animal Adaptations23;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations22;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations20;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations19

entity29.name: insects
entity29.description: Small invertebrate animals that are typically capable of flight and serve as a food source for various predators.;;;A class of invertebrates that are characterized by having six legs, a body divided into three parts (head, thorax, abdomen), and often wings.

entity31.name: wing shape
entity31.description: The specific form or structure of the wings that contributes to the swift's ability to glide efficiently.

entity33.name: miles
entity33.description: A unit of length or distance, commonly used to measure the extent of travel or migration.

entity34.name: barreleye fish
entity34.description: A type of aquatic animal with a transparent head that helps it avoid predators.;;;A deep-sea dwelling fish with a transparent head and tubular eyes that point upward.;;;A deep-sea fish with a transparent head and barrel-shaped eyes that can rotate to look upwards.;;;A type of deep-sea fish known for its unique barrel-shaped eyes.
entity34.chunkid: Unusual Animal Adaptations27;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations25;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations26;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations24

entity35.name: ocean
entity35.description: The vast body of saltwater that covers most of the Earth's surface, where deep-sea creatures like the barreleye fish can be found.;;;A large body of saltwater that covers most of the Earth's surface.

entity37.name: deep sea
entity37.description: The part of the ocean that is far below the surface, characterized by extreme pressure, cold temperatures, and darkness.

entity39.name: predators
entity39.description: Other animals that hunt and eat smaller creatures, in this case lurking below the fish.

entity42.name: aye-aye
entity42.description: A nocturnal lemur native to Madagascar, known for its unique elongated middle finger used for extracting insects from tree bark.;;;A type of lemur, known for its unique foraging behavior and specialized adaptations.;;;A nocturnal lemur native to Madagascar, known for its unique method of finding food by tapping on trees.;;;A type of lemur native to Madagascar, known for its unique elongated middle finger.;;;A nocturnal lemur native to Madagascar, known for its unique method of finding and extracting insect larvae from trees using a long, thin middle finger.
entity42.chunkid: Unusual Animal Adaptations29;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations32;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations28;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations30;;;Unusual Animal Adaptations31

entity43.name: Madagascar
entity43.description: An island country in the Indian Ocean off the southeastern coast of Africa, home to a diverse range of endemic species including lemurs.

entity46.name: wood surface
entity46.description: The outer layer or face of a piece of wood, often used as a material in construction and furniture.

entity50.name: primates
entity50.description: An order of mammals that includes humans, apes, monkeys, and prosimians like the aye-aye.

entity51.name: animal kingdom
entity51.description: The animal kingdom is a taxonomic rank that includes all multicellular, eukaryotic organisms classified as animals.

entity52.name: regenerative abilities
entity52.description: The capability of an organism to regenerate lost or damaged body parts.

entity53.name: powerful punches
entity53.description: A physical characteristic that allows certain animals to deliver strong blows, often used for defense or hunting.

entity54.name: protective armor
entity54.description: Structures such as shells, scales, or thick skin that protect an organism from physical harm.

entity55.name: specialized foraging techniques
entity55.description: Specific methods used by animals to find and collect food, adapted to their environment and diet.

entity57.name: Earth
entity57.description: The third planet from the Sun, where life as we know it exists.
